definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
red neckscarf/by extension, a member of the Young Pioneers

sentences.english: We still remember last year, when the first scene scarf to wear it?
sentences.chinese: 还记得我们上一年级时，第一次戴上领巾时的情景吗？

sentences.english: Students, and red scarf is a flag of the iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 同学们，红领巾是国旗的一角。

sentences.english: This is a scarf designed by Doir.
sentences.chinese: 这是由迪奥计划的领巾。

sentences.english: The collar was a high band with a white cotton sash tied in a big flamboyant bow at the neck.
sentences.chinese: 圆领，白色纯棉领巾在脖子处打成一个华丽的大领结。

sentences.english: And of course pioneers wore a red pioneer tie, the main must-have item.
sentences.chinese: 当然，少先队员们是肯定会带上红领巾的。

sentences.english: Look, all of those Young Pioneers are wearing their red scarves .
sentences.chinese: 看，所有的那些少先队员都戴着红领巾。

sentences.english: That is good to wear red scarf from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 那就是先从佩戴好红领巾开始。

sentences.english: They [the kids] know what the green scarf means even if nobody says anything.
sentences.chinese: 就算别人不说什么，孩子也知道绿领巾是啥意思。

sentences.english: Volunteers learned how to wear the red scarf.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者们在学习系红领巾。

sentences.english: He wore black scarf on his neck. so sexy.
sentences.chinese: 他脖子上系了一条黑色的领巾，好性感。

sentences.english: A school scarf has its own special colours which show where you are a student.
sentences.chinese: 学校的领巾带有特殊颜色来显示你是哪个学校的学生。

sentences.english: She made her son a scarf.
sentences.chinese: 她为她的儿子做了一条领巾。

sentences.english: My doll has a blue scarf.
sentences.chinese: 我的玩具娃娃有一条蓝色的领巾。

sentences.english: The red kerchief is worn by many first school students in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国的许多小学生都戴红领巾。

sentences.english: I have found some great deals on items that you need everyday, like bottles and bibs .
sentences.chinese: 我发现一些大的项目，你需要交易，每天象瓶和领巾。

sentences.english: The bright red scarf is Young Pioneer's symbol.
sentences.chinese: 鲜艳的红领巾就是少先队员的标志。

definition: red neckscarf/by extension, a member of the Young Pioneers
armband (e.g. as part of uniform or to show status)
to tie on/to buckle up/to fasten
